result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeremy J. Schoenick in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy J. Schoenick is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Schoenick

defendant.name: Schoenick, Jeremy J.
defendant.address: 1111 Bald Eagle Road N. #Q1, Hudson, WI 54016

records.addlTxt: Document 8 and 9 erased. Petition/Order for attorney's fees. It was filed under 21CT12 and copied to this case. Petition/ordered should be filed under one case only.

10:13 AM Defendant Jeremy J. Schoenick in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CT12 and 22CM26 heard at this time. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 in 21CT12. dismiss Ct#2 and 22CM26. IDIP sentencing: 40 days jail, 30 days stayed, 10 days to be served on EHM. $1429 fine, 12 months revocation of DL and IID. Atty Loberg and Defendant agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 21CT12. Counsel stipulates to factual basis.   Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1 in 21CT12, dismisses Ct#2 and 22CM26. ADA Walker and Atty Loberg address sentencing.
Court orders on Ct#1- 40  Days Jail sentence is imposed. 30 Days of the Jail sentence is stayed pending successful completion of the IDIP program. The remaining  10  Days jail will be served on EHM and with good time will begin on June 23, 2022  at 10:00 am. $1429.00 fine due 6 months, 12 months revocation of driver's license, credit for any administrative suspension, 12 months IID, AODA and driver safety plan. 1 day jail credit.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:25

03:57 PM Defendant Jeremy J. Schoenick in Court with Attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CT12 & 22CM26.  ADA Walker advises Defendant still working on IDIP program, requests continued hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on April 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

10:15 AM Defendant Jeremy J. Schoenick in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $ SIBS w/conditions of , no objection, Court so orders. Court adjourned at 10:18 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
